Player History
Drafted in 8th round, 145th overall pick, by Chicago (N) in 1965...
Drafted in 2nd round, 25th overall pick, by New York (N) in 1966...
Traded from New York (N) to Pittsburgh on 1/31/1968 (Going to PIT: C J. Bench, LF S. Braun, P R. Klimkowski, P B. Moose, P G. Nolan. Going to NYM: LF W. Stargell, P B. Veale)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1969, off Bob Veale (NYM)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/7/1969, off Dick Kelley (ATL)...
Injured on 4/28/1970 with a Pulled Rib Cage Muscle, out for one week...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1970...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Los Angeles on 6/14/1971...
Signed as a free agent by Texas on 2/2/1975 to a 3-year deal worth $3,500,000 per year...
